text.__SUMMARY__: The Sindh thread snake (Myriopholis blanfordi) is a species of harmless blind snake in the family Leptotyphlopidae. The species is endemic to India and the Middle East.
text.Etymology: M. blanfordi is named after English naturalist William Thomas Blanford (1832–1905), member of the Geological Survey of India.
text.Subspecies: There are no subspecies of M. blanfordi that are currently recognized as being valid.
text.Geographic range: M. blanfordi is found in India, Pakistan (Baluchistan and North-West Frontier Province), Afghanistan, possibly Iran, south to Mecca through the Arabian Peninsula from Aden through Yemen. The type locality given is "Sind" [Punjab, India].
